page.title: 03TRANSPORT : THE WALL AREA.
page.content:
Although a mainly rural area there is a large network of roadways serving the region, linking with major settlements at Lichfield, Walsall and Birmingham. The focus of the road system is the A5 Watling Street which crosses the A5127 Sutton Coldfield to Lichfield, and A461 Walsall to Lichfield, roads. Proposals are being considered at the present time to enlarge the A5 into a six lane highway whilst four other alternative routes are being considered to ease traffic congestion in the Birmingham region.
The Lichfield to Birmingham railway provides both passenger and freight services but the Lichfield to Walsall line is only used for oil freight to Brownhills. The Wyrley and Essington canal which is now disused formerly ran through the middle of the area.
